Sequence Information.Mechanism of action: N peptide may target an exposed C-helix region of gp41 and can interact with their coiled coil formation within a gp41 dimer,which can inhibit HIV-1 entry.

Literature.Title: Virus-cell and cell-cell fusion mediated by the HIV-1 envelope glycoprotein is inhibited by short gp41 N-terminal membrane-anchored peptides lacking the critical pocket domain.
Literature.Author: Wexler-Cohen Y, Ashkenazi A, Viard M, Blumenthal R, Shai Y.
